meanings.definition: The part of the mind in which innate instinctive impulses and primary processes are manifest.
meanings.sent1: My id tells me to eat when I'm hungry.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist studied the patient's id to understand their behavior.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes my id makes me do silly things like eating ice cream for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: Her id was like a wild animal, untamed and impulsive.
meanings.sent5: The id is like a hidden force that guides our actions without us realizing.

meanings.definition: A document serving as evidence or as an identifier.
meanings.sent1: I need to show my id to prove my age.
meanings.sent2: The police officer checked his id before letting him enter the building.
meanings.sent3: His id was his ticket to the exclusive event.
meanings.sent4: The id was his key to accessing restricted areas.
meanings.sent5: The id is like a secret code that unlocks doors to different places.

meanings.definition: A means of identification, as a card or bracelet.
meanings.sent1: She wore her id around her wrist at all times.
meanings.sent2: The id badge granted him access to the secure facility.
meanings.sent3: His id bracelet was a fashion statement as well as an access pass.
meanings.sent4: The id card was his ticket to enter the event.
meanings.sent5: The id is like a magic token that opens doors to new opportunities.
